column5: Well the day finaly came for the musky opener I was all geared up and had a charter with reelpro.ca for the day. We hit a lake just north of Simco around 8 am not sure which one  After about 10 casts the first fish of the day hit a healthy 37"er  This is the only pic I got with my camera.  My buddy Kev got a small guy about 2 hours later  After that I kept hitting 2-3 lb smallies on big bucktails.  Also a PB 22" walleye.  Yeah I dont fish walleye  In all had a great day on the water.  Learnt alot from Mike our guide.  Heading out again this Thursday to Cameron lake for some more skis.
Nice report!  You need more spinner baits in your arsenal. Thats pretty much all I use......  Sinker
Nicely done.  Looks like you had a great day.
Sounds like a day well spent on the lake catching some quality fish. Thanks for sharing.
